text: Brickellia frutescens (shrubby brickellbush) is a North American species of flowering plant in the daisy family. It is native to desert regions of Arizona, southern Nevada, southern California, and Baja California.Biota of North America Program 2014 county distribution mapTurner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272 Brickellia frutescens is a shrub up to 60 cm (2 feet) tall. It is highly branched, with many small purple flower heads.Flora of North America, Brickellia frutescens A. Gray, Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts. 17: 207. 1882. ==References== ==External links== frutescens Category:Flora of Baja California Category:Flora of the Southwestern United States Category:Plants described in 1882
title: Brickellia frutescens
